They were even allowed to use the wireless internet connection, which was how Aime was able to access the boy's former bank account so easily.

Pharynn also knew that the boy was a member of a few social networking sites, and used instant messaging to connect with people who should no longer be his contacts. He was not entitled to any contacts that she did not approve of and she certainly did not want him to have any kind of online presence. The boy had no imagination though. He used one password for all his internet activities and Pharynn knew what it was. It would be a simple matter to close all those connections. She would in fact do it the next time she accessed her computer. His social networking sites, online journal, web based email accounts, instant messaging contacts... they were all history. His web site too would be closed down permanently. There would be no trace of him anywhere in cyberspace. She considered the idea of sending spiteful messages to everybody on his contact lists before she removed them but then she thought why bother? Without any form of internet presence, there was no way any of them would ever be able to get in touch with him anyway.

So now she was richer to the tune of a few thousand units of currency. She would make a point of visiting a cash point tomorrow and double checking that balance just to remind herself. She had never before felt so rich, so empowered as she did right now. She would even spend some of it, not all of course.. most of it would stay in her account but she felt the need to buy something for herself with money that once belonged to him. It would be something she could keep in her bedroom so he would be reminded of it every day, and it would have to be something feminine that she could use every day and take great pleasure in using - just like she was doing with him right now. She couldn't quite decide what it should be though.

"oh yes, girls rule the world" she mused quietly to herself "just as this girl rules her own tiny boy and will continue to do so forever"

Her one regret was that her mother would be spending her own money to clear his former debts. Whilst she did not want to ever owe anybody anything she didn't like the idea of Aime digging into her own pocket to cover the payment. She also felt a little guilty about her mother doing so much for her by producing and actioning all those legal documents, wiping her new computer, sewing those patches in her clothes for her and the various other jobs she had agreed to carry out on her behalf. She was having so much fun sitting on her boy though that she really didn't want to move. He was exactly where she wanted him and she fully intended to keep him there. Fortunately Aime seemed to understand this.

There was something else too... oh yes, his girlfriend. What any decent girl saw in that particular boy she had no idea, and his girlfriend really was a very pleasant young woman. Pharynn had always liked her, and felt sorry for her that she had chosen that particular boy to go out with. Pharynn knew he was stringing her along, but that was going to stop today. One single phone call should do it. She would tell the other girl that he had dumped her of course. She would also let slip that he was two-timing her as she had discovered he was spending a great deal of time in the company of a younger girl and that the two of them had become very close. In a way that was true, he had indeed although perhaps not in the way that the girlfriend might think. She could even fabricate a letter from this girl in which she spoke of her great affection from her, then claim to have simply found it. Yes, that would be sure to end his relationship with her.

Unfortunately though, Pharynn knew the girl wouldn't be home until later, so she couldn't call her until after dinner. She wasn't likely to forget though, she wouldn't miss a golden opportunity like this.

Pharynn sighed. Everything was proceeding just as it should Plans were in place or already being enacted, his life such it was had been destroyed and his world had been reduced to one of darkness and crushing pressure beneath her backside. She was content. Quietly she picked up her book and started reading again where she had left off.

From the moment Aime had left the room, all the activity around him seemed to have stopped abruptly He didn't hear Pharynn's quiet musing or her sigh. Both of these were far too faint to register on his ears. The flow of time that he was able to perceive as movement and conversation took place around it ceased once more and he again felt as though he was trapped in an eternal, everlasting single instant. When his aunt had come into the room, Pharynn had clearly asked her to give no hint of how long 'the boy' as she now called him had been trapped beneath her, and of course she had willingly obliged. He still had no clue how long he had been imprisoned beneath her.. had it been minutes? hours? days? years? He couldn't say.

He thought again of what his life had become. Was it a life? Could he be considered truly alive? He had lost everything apparently, he had no money, no property, no freedom, no identity of his own and soon he would have no job. That idea about the patches in her school uniform sounded like an absolute nightmare. She was sitting on him here, was she intending to do the same when she got to school? It sounded that way.

Even when it had only been minutes away that there had been activity in this room, the endless silence of this endless unchanging moment in which he lived returned so rapidly that he soon could not say how long ago he had experienced that short period of linear reality. Time once more had no meaning for him, even in his flattened form her pressure upon him was as intense as it had always been. Nothing changed. The darkness, the light fragrance mixed with her body heat and enormous pressure. These were his only realities now and his only awareness he had of the world and his place within it. The truth was that the world was no longer a part of his life. Buried deeply beneath the girl's backside his only reality was her. In total darkness and utter silence he knew of nothing beyond her. All he knew, all he perceived was her butt cheeks pressing down upon him. The world, even her bedroom was lost to him so completely that it was like they had never been there in the first place.

Above him, Pharynn slowly made her way through the book she was reading. She of course could see the room around her. The light coming through her window was not lost to her like it was denied to her boy. Now that she was no longer discussing him in front of her mother, she once again made no outward sign that she was even aware of him. He knew none of this of course, he had no idea what she was doing other than the fact that she seemed ot be sitting perfectly still upon him. Her backside severed his awareness completely from anything that was happening from the world around it. She denied him light, she gave him no hint of perception other than the feeling of being covered by her backside, she had even severed his awareness of the normal passage of time. There was only reality for him, and she was it. As she continued to sit and read, that remained the only truth he was ever offered.

123211121121112121212.content:
It was a couple of hours later, when Pharynn had quietly read through several more chapters of her book when there came another knock at the door.

"Come in, mother" she offered putting a marker in her book and laying it on the corner of her dressing table.
This time Aime didn't need to ask if the coast was clear, she knew where the boy would be and that there wsa no way he could ever escape from beneath her daughter.

"Your dinner, love" Aime called as she entered the room
"Thanks" Pharynn replied "I'm feeling ravenous and it looks so deliciious. You really have outdone yourself this time."
"Thanks" Aime smiled "how nice of you to say so"
"It is the truth" Pharynn explained, eager to make a start on the meal.

"I'll be back in a bit to collect the tray when you are done" Aime informed her "but don't feel rushed. I have my own plate to get through after all."
"Of course" Pharynn grinned

Her boy of course, could tell by the new activity in the room and the aroma of the meal that had been offered to the young girl above him that two hours had passed since he had last been aware of anything happening in the outside world, and that dinner was now being served. That meant that the girl had been sitting on him for more than two hours but he still had no idea how long precisely.

The aroma was coming from that plate made her mouth water in anticipation, and she was sure that the smell of her dinner would not be lost on the boy she was still firmly sitting upon. Like she said though, he would be allowed none of it. She really hoped he could smell it too, it would add to his torment to catch the aroma of a meal that she was deliberately denying him.

As she took up her knife and fork and started eating, Pharynn could see that her initial assessment had been correct, the meal had been cooked perfectly, the lamb was so tender it almost fell apart on the fork and delicately seasoned with a range of spices that complimented it perfectly. The veg and potatoes were cooked just as she liked them and the gravy was rich and thick, just like her boy used to be... Well perhaps she was only half right. If he had maxed out on that credit card then he could hardly have been called rich, and now of course he had no money at all. He had always been thick though. She decided to take up her mother's advice. This meal was too good to be rushed, she was going to savour every exquisite mouthful.

As she ate, her mind wandered to the boy. She was taking a great delight in causing him as much discomfort as she could possibly imagine, and instead of facing that prospect with any doubts or feelings of disapproval, she found that she took great delight in the torment she was causing him. She had been sitting on him for several hours now, and she felt quite content to keep him here for the foreseeable future.

She was not normally a cruel or vindictive girl. In fact with most people she was welcoming, polite and generally quite pleasant, especially when they afforded her the same courtesy. When others were cruel or hurtful towards her though then she could be quite scathing towards them, and even used violence when it seemed like the most appropriate course of action. She was certainly not the delicate little flower that the boy had always thought she was but then she had never let that side of her truly emerge in front of him before now. At school she commended enormous respect from staff and pupils alike. The staff were aware of the fact that she effectively ruled the roost and kept order better than they ever could, and the pupils were so nervous around her that nobody in their right mind ever dared to cross her. That school was hers and everybody who went there knew it. The trouble was that the boy hadn't been to that school for years.

The fact remained that the boy was twice her age, even though she had said a few unpleasant things to him when he had been particularly annoying, she didn't fancy her chances against him in any kind of physical struggle so she had grudgingly given in to him. Now that he was no more than a midget though, it was clear that the tables had turned for him. Now she was going to spend the rest of eternity making him pay for his mistakes, and boy would he pay! After all there was bullying, and then there was BULLYING!

She had plans for him, oh yes indeed. She had already taken from him his possessions and his freedom. He belonged to her now. She was severing all ties to anybody who played even the least significant role in his life She had plunged his world into darkness and silence. She hard blurred, distorted, even destroyed his sense of reality by removing from him any sense of the passage of time. She was denying him his identity, his rights, his very humanity. She would regularly even dismiss his gender by not even referring to him as a boy, but merely and object or a thing... if she even spoke of him at all. Until the end of time he would be nothing, he would have nothing other than what she would allow him and that was virtually nothing. He would live with a girl, belong to a girl be surrounded by femininity yet he was not a girl. Girls had status, girls had rights, and girls were afforded certain freedoms, girls were human. He would have none of these things. Girls were so far above him that he could not even hope to attain their level of perfection. He was sub-human, sub-femme, beneath girls. As she continued to sit upon him and devour her meal she was more than aware that he was certainly beneath her, not only physically but mentally, biologically and any other way that could possibly be measured - and that of course is where she would keep him.

Masculinity would of course never feature in his life again. He would live in the company of girls who did girlie things in the kinds of places where girls like to hang out. He would spend his entire life among girls but he would never be given any opportunity to count himself among them. He would be shunned by girls yet he would aspire to be counted among them as he would know no other lifestyle. He would never be admitted into their ranks however, she would encourage them all to see him as a lesser form of life, not worthy of their company and any who did not comply with her advice would be cut off from him forever.

In time she was sure that he would think of himself as a lower form of life, utterly insignificant in his own eyes as well as those of others and under the absolute authority of the girl who owned him. She had already denied him his freedom, if she then took from him his humanity, his sense of purpose, his drive, and even his free will then that truly would be bullying and no less than her boy deserved. She was sure that she was going to love every perfect moment of it.

The boy himself was feeling more than a little restless, he could smell the lamb that had been so expertly cooked and seasoned which he was sure was being eaten by the girl still sitting on him. He loved lamb but he had heard Pharynn say that she was no longer going to offer him any regular human food. What exactly was he going to eat then? Was she planning on starving him? He did not, and could not know.

1232111211211121212122.content:
Once she had finished eating, Pharynn decided the time was right for her to call the girlfriend, and end her boy's relationship with her permanently. She should surely be back home by now. She took her mobile phone out of the handbag that lay at the side of her dressing table and started dialling the older girl's number. It wasn't hard for Pharynn to acquire this number since the boy had stored it as one of the pre-sets on the house phone a while back and she had an eidetic memory.

She had a somewhat evil and malicious smile on her face as the phone started dialling.

"Hello" the voice came from the other end of the line, it was a young woman's voice and Pharynn recognised it instantly.
"Hi, Steph" Pharynn responded "It's me, Pharynn. I felt I had to call because I found out something really quite unpleasant that you really ought to know."
"Oh, what"
"Brace yourself, this is going to come as quite a shock. It is about Richard, and it is going to be more than a little distressing." She hated to refer to him by his former name, but under the circumstances she felt it was the best option on this occasion. It was the easiest way to make it clear to the other girl, whom exactly she was referring to.
"Oh dear, what happened" Steph gasped.
"Well I saw a letter addressed to him on the dining table a while back. The wording is of an intimate nature and clearly it is from someone other than yourself. It is clear to me that there is another woman in his life."
"No!" she gasped.
"I am sorry to be the bearer of bad news but there is no denying it. The letter clearly speaks of romantic attraction between the two of them. "
"I'd like to see this letter"
"of course, I'll pop it in the post straight away, you should get it in the next couple of days." As she spoke she picked up a pen and paper and started writing a letter from this apparent 'other woman'. She even used a handwriting style so vastly differerent from her usual one that the older girl could never recognise it, then she signed it "love and kisses, your darling Rachel". She was careful not to make too much noise when she wrote as she didn't want to alert the woman on the other end of the phone as to what she was doing
"Thanks Pharynn" Steph sighed "thanks for letting me know before I let myself get truly hurt by that MONSTER. If I ever see him again, I'LLl KILL HIM""
"It was the least I could do, I am only sorry that I should be the bearer or such awful news. Goodbye"

Pharynn hard the other girl sobbing as she hung up. Clearly Steph was upset by the incident, Pharynn knew that he really was stringing her along and that he had been unfaithful to her on a number of occasions, she could just never do anything about it until now. Steph had threatened to kill him, but if only she knew that he was suffering a much more terrible fate than any murder she could ever have devised then surely her homicidal instincts would evaporate in an instant. She doubted the two of them would ever seem each other again. Once she got that letter, Steph would stay far away from him and even if they did meet by any possible chance, she was hardly likely to recognise him at his diminiative size. No, it was clear that Steph was now out of his life for good. Soon Pharynn would wipe her number of the house phone memory and post the letter she had written, then she would be gone from all their lives forever.

From underneath her, the boy heard the entire conversation. So Pharynn had told Steph that he was cheating on her. That was true of course but he wondered how the girl had found out. Of course, she had chosen the name Rachel and none of his 'bits on the side' answered to that name. Despite that one mistake it was clear to him now that Steph would be out of his life Once Pharynn sent that letter she was clearly faking she would never want to see him again, or maybe she would kill him as she had threatened to do right now. He was sure it wouldn't be safe for him to ever come face-to-face with Steph again, she wasn't the forgiving sort and since he had not even given the appearance of going 'steady' with any other girl, None of those chance encounters with scantily clad women on darkened street corners could possibly be called relationships. No, the girl had just closed yet another door in his life.

Pharynn had now finished the letter, she folded it and placed it inside an envelope. Steph's address was bound to be in the boy's little black book and she knew where he kept that. The letter would be in the post tomorrow with a first class stamp on the front and Steph would no doubt be reading it the very next day. His love life was obviously, clearly and decisively over now. She could almost hear the clatter of his life coming crashing down around his ears. From her vantage point, sat firmly and entirely upon his shrunken body, she would watch as everything he so desperately clung on to shattered into tiny pieces. She would then take those fragments and grind them into dust before gently blowing them in the direction of the four winds until nothing was left. Destroying his world was so gratifying, she loved every single moment of it.

12321112112111212121221.content:
Shortly after Pharynn had completed the letter and folded it into the envelope, there was another polite knock on the door. "Hello again" came the voice from the other side.
"Come in, mother" Pharynn announced cheerfully "I've finished the meal, and you have my very best compliments, it was delicious."
Aime wandered into the room and closed the door again. She was carrying a plastic bag which quite clearly wasn't empty. "How nice of you to say so" she smiled "who were you talking to on the phone?"
"Steph"
"Oh, how come? I didn't think you would want to bother too much with his girlfriend."
"She isn't his girlfriend, not any more"
"Why, what happened"
"She told him where to stick their relationship" she explained "I informed her of how I found out he was seeing somebody else on the side."
"And she believed you"
"It sounded that way to me, especially when I mentioned the letter from 'your darling Rachel'. There were so many romantic and clearly intimate lines in there to leave no doubt as to its intent."
"Do you have this letter by any chance?"
It is right there" she pointed, indicating the clearly full envelope. I just wrote it. It'll be in the post to her tomorrow, I even said so."
"Won't she recognise your handwriting?"
"No, I wrote in a hand other than my own She won't suspect a thing."
"You haven't written her address on the envelope"
"It'll be in his little black address book, I know where he keeps that."
Aime laughed "I guess that should do it all right"
"I believe so" Pharynn confirmed "especially from the way she screamed the line 'I'LL KILL HIM' down the phone at me. I think from the expressiveness and venom in that statement, we can clearly assume that she no longer holds any romantic feelings towards him."
Aime laughed even harder. "I think it is safe to say that Steph has left him then"
"Indeed" Pharynn agreed "I always felt sorry for that young woman anyway, I have no idea what she saw in the boy She was far too good a person fror the likes of him. Hopefully her next choice will be human for a change, it is never good news when people date outside their own species."

Aime laughed even harder. Oh that daughter of hers could deliver some really cutting lines at time. She was certainly not someone who any sane person would ever enter a verbal fencing match with. They were likely to come away bleeding from all kinds of places. She didn't suspect for a moment that the remark was a one-off either. Clearly she saw him as something less than human, or was merely denying his humanity in front of him. Either way she felt it prudent to play along.

"So he isn't even human, I take it."
"He was never human" Pharynn declared "he never was and never will be. He was excluded from the human race at the moment of his conception. If he ever saw himself that way then he is quite clearly deluded. He is even more removed from the human race than are insects, and even single cell protozoa have more chance at attaining a human status than he ever will. He is an affront to the human race, similar only in appearance but never in substance He is weaker and smaller than the child who was born yesterday. The fact that he exists at all is a matter of total insignificance in the eyes of all of creation. He is subhuman even sub-natural He is the most worthless life form to ever have been mistakenly permitted to come into existence at all."
"I see" Aime chuckled "and is that how I should see him too?"
"Of course" she nodded "that is his position in the grand scheme of things, at the very bottom of every pecking order that was ever devised. Besides, as his owner is it not up to me to determine his place in the world, such as it is?"
"Of course it is dear" Aime nodded "he shall always be whatever you deem him to be"

"Have you finished with your tray, dear?" Aime asked after a moment
"Yes thanks" Pharynn replied "what have you got in that bag by the way?"
"A few bits and pieces" Aime responded "His keys, his wallet. I thought you might want to have the satisfaction of destroying all his cards yourself. There is a reasonable amount of money in there too which I am sure you want to transfer into your own hands. There is also every letter in this house that was ever addressed to him, a few more forms of identity, a document shredder and one of your skirts. You might want to see if I have attached that patch pocket the way you want it before I start on the rest."

"Quite a treasure trove of trinkets then" Pharynn giggled. She pulled out the document shredder and empted the rest of the contents onto the top of her dressing table. As Aime plugged in the device, she opened up the wallet, tipped out the cards and transferred all the money to her own purse and dropped both keys and purse into her handbag

"Did you wipe my new computer?" she enquired as she took up a pair of scissors and started cutting into the first of his cards.

"Of course" Aime smiled "I formatted the hard drive then reinstalled the operating system. It was easy and I had so much fun doing it. That boy didn't seem to know the meaning of the word security. He hadn't even put a password on his system BIOS. If I can borrow a pen and paper, I'll write down the new passwords I created. No doubt you will change them to something only you know as soon as possible."
"Naturally" Pharynn nodded "and you can use that pen and pad." She passed them across to her. Pharynn always like to keep a handy supply of stationary around. In moments Aime had written down a couple of phrases on the paper. The top one is what I set up on the BIOS she remarked and the one underneath is the code to get into the system. That is the only account on there and it has administrator privileges. I haven't bothered with a guest account. If you don't know that code then you don't get into the system. Also, once I installed the system, I went into the set up and made sure the system could only boot from the hard disk, not any of the external drives. "

"Then only you and I can get on" Pharynn remarked "only you and I know that code, and once I change it to something only I know then nobody but me will be able to get on to that computer. I never reveal my codes to anyone. I like that you changed the boot sequence to the most secure option too and passworded the bios. That password will also change of course." She had now cut the first of the cards into nothing more than fragments and had started on the next.

"Safest way", Aime remarked "you don't want jsut anybody to be able to get on there"
"When I update the passwords, not even you will get on there"
"As it should be, it is your computer after all"

"So apart from the system itself, is there anything else on there?" Having memorised the passwords her mother had written down, Pharynn took the piece of paper on which they were written, slipped it in to her mouth, chewed for a few moments and swallowed. There was no way anybody was ever going to see those, even if they were only temporary.

"The usual" Aime stated "video and sound card drivers, a professional firewall, virus scanner, spy ware blocker and ad removal tool. Once I saw the net would be secure I hooked it up to the wireless connection. and started the process of downloading all the critical system updates, virus definitions etc. I also wiped all his memory cards. When I am done your new system will be safe, secure and up-to-date."

"Thanks a lot, mother" Pharynn stated, happily "did you destroy his data discs too?"

"He doesn't have too many here with him" she replied "but those he does have are are right here." She took a box of discs out of her bag That shredder can shatter discs as easily as it cuts through paper by the way."

"Oh, I am going to have so much destructive fun with this lot." Pharynn announced

"I'm sure you will" Aime grinned "incidentally, he was security conscious in one respect. It seems his laptop case is the kind that you need a key to be able to open. Fortunately that key is one of those on the keyring you dropped into your handbag, as are your new car keys and a set of house keys for your aunt and uncle's house where the boy once lived. I am sure that those last ones will help you to transfer the ownership of all the rest of your new possessions that now reside there."

"You think of everything, don't you mother?" Pharynn smiled as she gently patted her handbag and heard the faint jingle of keys inside

"I certainly try" Aime admitted "but even if I didn't I am sure you would "I don't think anything ever escapes your attention"

"He sure won't" Pharynn admitted "especially when you consider where I have him incarcerated. He is in a more secure prison than Alkatraz ever was."

"He probably can't suffer a worse fate even if he died and was condemned to eternal damnation"

"After a few days he will probably wish that was exactly where he was." Pharynn grinned "It is surely more than a little warm where he is right now. The afterlife is not going to be any better for him though, after all I own him there as well. To all intents and purpose I am his goddess now. I will not be showing him any mercy, ever but he will soon learn to worship me."

"Compelled to pay homage to a deity who shows him nothing but contempt in return" Aime laughed, "how deliciously ironic"

"Isn't it though? Pharynn grinned as she finished cutting up the last of the cards in the wallet. She rifled through it then having found nothing else in there she casually ripped it to shreds and threw it in the bin. "What use is a wallet to a girl?" she enquired "I have my purse, and my handbag. That is enough for me."

"That is a good point" Aime agreed "before you start shredding that pile of worthless objects on your desk though, do you want to have a look at that skirt I was working on?"

"Of course" Pharynn's eyes brightened mischievously.

Aime picked up the skirt and handed it to her daughter.

Pharynn looked it over carefully, from the outside it appeared to be no different from before. When she looked inside though, towards the back of the garment she saw the patch of fabric that had been attached. The stitching that held it in place seemed so discrete that she didn't even notice it, but a quick tug showed that it was affixed securely and would not come off. She could see which end was meant to be the opening of the pocket but try as she might she couldn't seem able to pull it open. What was she meant to do? It wasn't a zip, sorely it should lift open somehow?"

"How do I open this?" she enquired.

"You kind of squeeze it at both ends to release the seal" Aime admitted "it seemed like the most sensible option. A zip might be a little uncomfortable under your backside but hopefully you will hardly feel that fastener if at all. It will only open that way too, it won't pull free no matter how much pressure you apply so it is physically impossible to open from the inside.

"Wonderful" Pharynn exclaimed as she successfully managed to open the little pocket using the method her mother had suggested. She pushed her hand inside. It was a tight fit, very tight in fact." She had to hold the bottom of the pouch in order to provide the leverege to remove her hand."

"Did you want it any other way?" Aime enquired "I made it that way so he wouldn't be able to move all that much once he was trapped in there."

"You are right, it is best that way" Pharynn admitted "is the patch in the right place."

Aime held it against her back for a moment "I'd say it is in the perfect spot" she acknowledged "when you are wearing it, any time you sit down the patch will be positioned directly under your backside. If he was trapped inside you would be sitting on him as firmly as you are doing right now."

"In that case, it is the perfect template for all the rest" she laughed "that is exactly what i was hoping for."

"It sounds to me like the boy's primary role is going to be as a cushion for your backside"

"one of them, yes" Pharynn nodded "there will be others. He does seem to be well suited for that position. Using him as my seat cushion is so easy and so convenient, and of course he is such a joy to crush. I don't even need to think about it. Once he is in place he is simply there, I don't ned to do anything but relax and enjoy the experience."

"It sounds heavenly" Aime grinned "Do you actually crush him?"

"What else would you call it? He is smaller than one of my dolls and I am sitting on him so firmly it is a wonder he doesn't simply shatter under the pressure."

"I see your point"

"I thought you might."

Pharynn fired up the document shredder and dropped one of the discs into it. "You are right, they do shatter easily" she laughed as she heard a number of crunching sounds coming from the unit.

"I said they did" Aime replied.

She dropped in another, then another, and after the pile of discs she made short work of the small stack of documents.

"Well that is all that lot gone" Pharynn pointed out "thanks for the loan of the shredder.

"Any time" Aime replied as she unplugged the device and dropped it into the carrier bag she brought it in. She picked up the tray then carrying the shredder in the bag she walked out of the room

The boy considered what had transpired during the latest exchange. So his bank cards were gone, as was his money. The young girl headed out of the bathroom, down the stairs and back in to the kitchen. The bag containing her school supplies was on one of the kitchen counters. She picked it up and lifted the strap over her shoulder to carry it, then she slipped on her shoes and walked out of the door.

The school that Pharynn attended was a few miles from her home, and she tended to make use of a local bus service which dropped her off at the gates every day. The bus ride usually lasted around 30-40 minutes and arrived in plenty of time for her first lesson. It was a convenient and reliable service and it served her needs perfectly - especially now.

The stop where she caught her bus was on the next street to her own but it didn't take long to walk there. With all the fun that her her mother and herself had been having with the midget, she was cutting the timing a little fine but there was always a slight queue at the stop so she wasn't overly concerned.

She didn't seem to know many of the other passengers who were getting on but that didn't surprise her. It wasn't merely a school bus in its own right. There were a few students who used it but it was also frequented by adults travelling to work. She didn't feel like striking up a conversation with any of them so she held her tongue and waited quietly in line.

It didn't take long for the queue to diminish to the point that she herself was boarding the bus. She spoke the name of the school to the driver and paid her fare The ground floor seats seemed to be mainly occupied by middle aged or elderly passengers so she made her way towards the upper level.

She wanted to be sure, of course that the midget ended up back in its proper place so she used her left hand to hold the back of her skirt close to her body as she sat. Just like before she lifted her feet off the floor of the bus and focussed her full weight on the seat beneath her and her living seat cushion trapped inside its little pouch. She presented the appearing of a girl not intending to move from her position for the remainder of the journey, and as it happened that was indeed her plan.

As the bus moved away, Pharynn considered her little midget for a moment. Just a short while ago her mother and herself had deliberately squashed it as flat as a pancake, and right now it was in exactly the same place as it was even though only she was sitting on it this time. She was fairly sure she would succeed in flattening the tiny critter again at least once more today and it was entirely possible that would happen during her current bus ride. The more she thought about it, the more she welcomed the idea.

Pharynn sat quietly in the seat by the window that she had chosen shortly after she boarded the bus She was perfectly relaxed, calm, at peace with herself as the allowed the bus to slowly carry her towards her destination. None of the other passengers were aware that this young schoolgirl had a pocket patch sewn into the inside of her skirt, at the back, nor that if she allowed the back of her skirt to drop under her body when she sat down that it would enable her to sit upon whatever it was that the hidden pocket contained. They would have no clue that this hidden pocket contained a 3 inch tall living being that resembled a miniaturised 18 year old male but who according to the girl had no right to a gender and should not be considered human. They would not be aware that this creature was her property and that she had every right to make such determinations on its behalf nor that indeed right now sitting directly upon it and that she was taking advantage of the journey to deliberately and continually crush it beneath her backside. Nobody on this bus but the girl herself knew any of these things and it was a great comfort to her and gave a warm glow to her chest to know that she was doing precisely that.

She was considering the midget as she sat there, she was wondering if she was too absolute about certain issues that in her own mind could perhaps be afforded a little bit of leeway. She was thinking specifically of her choice to always refer to the thing of it, and wondering if perhaps she could perhaps reconsider that. The midget was right not to be human, not to be related to her any more and most certainly not to have did she only have to refer to it as it in her own thoughts? What about he? Could she do that? In public, and in fact out loud in any way of course the idea was out of the question. Openly the midget would always be referred to as it, especially within the range of its own tiny ears, but privately, in her own mind? The truth was she had derived enormous satisfaction from knowing that the midget she was continually sitting on was male, not human maybe but male none-the-less although she still liked the idea of thinking of the thing as her boy. Al right it was settled, in her own thoughts it was alright to use words like he, him or her boy to describe the midget but out loud the taboo would forever remain in effect. She was happy now she had settled that particular issue.

Beneath her the midget was once more trapped in a world of darkness, and the familiar light frangrance of the girl and her endless pressure of her backside moulding him firmly into whatever surface she was currently sitting upon. Sound was not denied to him this time though, he could hear the endless hum and feel the vibrations of an engine that showed that the girl was clearly on a bus and the surface in question was whichever seat she had happened to find. Those sounds, mixed with the chatter of the passengers on board offered him no comfort however. He was fairly sure that in a little time Pharynn would once more have what she referred to as a 'midget pancake' beneath her backside.

As at the next stop a few more people got on board. Pharynn even thought she recognised one young girl. This assessment was confirmed when a girl with long blonde har and brown eyes came upstairs and sat down beside her. "Hello Pharynn she called in a soft voice.

"Hey Lisa" Pharynn greeted her "How was your weekend"
"Just lovely" she replied "I am not looking forward to getting back to that school though?"
"What's up?"
"Well there is a new boy there called Steve Cooper, you might have heard of him."
"I can't say I have. What has he been doing?"
"He has been an absolute beast!" she exclaimed "saying such cruel things about me right to my face, jeering at me, hitting me, stealing my money. It has been awful."
Pharynn didn't like what she was hearing at all. If some new kid had started bullying her friend then it surely wouldn't be long before she looked him up and when she did she was going to show him what a terrible error of judgement he had made. It had to be a new kid of course, people at that school quickly learned not to bother that particular girl or anyone that she cared about.
"You want me to TALK to the boy?" Pharynn asked "perhaps add a little bit of chastisement into the bargain?"
"Oh would you?" Lisa asked "If you got involved I am sure he'll back off. Nobody bothers you, except maybe that bratty older cousin of yours."
Pharynn laughed "That situation has new been taken care of" she remarked "that particular creature will never worry me again."
"Creature?"
"A good as any, although I find midget to be more descriptive."
"Why midget?"
"Maybe I'll tell you later." She offered, She liked Lisa, she was sweet and kind, was around her own age, and the two of them saw eye to eye on a great many issues, and shared a lot of the same interests. They were a good match for one another, if she was going to let any of her friends in on her secret then Lisa was right at the top of her list. She didn't want to reveal the midget on the top deck of a public bus though. Such things were better done in quieter places behind closed doors.

The road surface under the bus became uneven as they started moving down a fairly long road that seemed to have speed bumps every few feet. Lisa was thinking that the bus was going perhaps a fraction too fast but Pharynn was enjoying it immensely. She couldn't help but think of what a wonderful squishing effect those bumps must be having on the midget trapped beneath her. She felt like she was riding the speed bumps like one rides a roller-coaster. She even shifted her weight slightly so she would drop down as firmly as possible on the midget every time the bus went over another bump.

The bumps unfortunately did not last forever, and eventually the bus turned into a more even street. Lisa couldn't help but feel relieved that she was no longer bouncing in her seat but Pharynn couldn't help but feel slightly disappointed.

Presently a ticket inspector boarded the bus. Lisa and Pharynn both produced their own tickets when they were asked to present them but the inspector didn't even acknowledge the existence of the midget. It really was like the midget was a non-entity in the world these days. The driver had not requested a fare from it either though of course that suited Pharynn just fine. She noticed that the inspector was making a special point of checking everybody's ticket, even going so far as detaining a couple of boys at the back who had apparently sneaked on board without paying. The inspector was not paying any attention to the seats themselves though. That was why the midget was overlooked, he was simply her her seat or at least a part of it and therefore was except from paying a fare. That was a far more satisfying thought than the plain and simple truth that he was simply hidden from view, trapped under her backside.

Presently the inspector left and the bus continued on its way, minus the two boys at the back of course. Pharynn and Lisa both sat and spoke quietly together of various matters of interest to themselves. Pharynn skilfully kept the conversation centred on matters that were of a great deal of interest to girls but which boys, and yet boys themselves were never mentioned. They spoke about the latest fashions, of shoes, of issues relating to the bodies of their own bodies and how girls are likely to feel before and during puberty. They mentioned the latest brands of beauty products, cosmetics, their favourite perfumes, basically everything Pharynn could think of that would centre the midget's tiny mind on girls and their issues. She was encasing him in a world of all things female from which he could never leave. Lisa on the other hand was just enjoying the company, and the conversation.

From his place under Pharynn, the midget was not enjoying the conversation at all. Fashions? Perfumes? The development of the female body? What possible use were these subjects to him (yes, the girl permitted herself to think of him as him now even if she would never sat it) He hated being subjected to girl talk but then it seemed natural somehow. since the two people sitting there were quite clearly girls. He had never heard of this Lisa person before but from what he heard she was just as much a girlie girl as Pharynn. This was turning out to be a particularly unpleasant journey for him.

Squirt? They were definitely getting off on the wrong foot if he was going to start throwing casual insults at her. Nevertheless she was ready to issue her demands to the macho idiot. The attitude adjustment could come later if necessary.

Pharynn didn't bother returning the gesture, she felt her muscles could speak for themselves, she didn't have to show them off.

She said the 'or worse' part because an idea was starting to form in her mind. If the boy turned out to be as bothersome as she suspected he was going to be then perhaps she could have a quiet word with her mother some time, then maybe Lisa could have her own little midget to amuse herself with. That idea kind of appealed somehow and surely she would be doing a truly wonderful service for her friend.
